text: Zavala County is a county in the U.S. state of Texas. It was founded in 1858. It was named for Lorenzo de Zavala, who was the first vice president of the Republic of Texas. As of 2020, 9,670 people lived there. Its county seat is Crystal City. The county has a total area of . == Places == === City === * Crystal City (county seat) === Other === * Amaya * Batesville * Chula Vista * Cometa * La Pryor * Loma Grande == References == Category:Texas counties Category:1858 establishments in the United States Category:1850s establishments in Texas
title: Zavala County, Texas
